text:
I have an unregistered package that depends on another unregistered package and when CI runs as a github action, I get:
```ERROR: expected package `RayTracing [3007c720]` to be registered```
How can I make visible RayTracing.jl to my other package?

elements.text: I have an unregistered package that depends on another unregistered package and when CI runs as a github action, I get:
ERROR: expected package `RayTracing [3007c720]` to be registered
How can I make visible RayTracing.jl to my other package?

text:
So you either need to register it, or you need to manually add it. I’m going to assume the latter option is easier, in which case you could add the lines _before_ `julia-buildpkg`
```- name: install RayTracing
  run: |
    julia --project=@. -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.add(PackageSpec(url="URL_OF_UNREGISTERED_PACAKGE"))'```

elements.text: So you either need to register it, or you need to manually add it. I’m going to assume the latter option is easier, in which case you could add the lines

  run: |
    julia --project=@. -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.add(PackageSpec(url="URL_OF_UNREGISTERED_PACAKGE"))'

text: <https://github.com/rvignolo/NeutronTransport.jl/blob/main/.github/workflows/ci.yml>
in the github action workflow yaml file, the same one where your CI is defined

text:
yeah, add those lines (with correct indentation) right before the
```- uses: julia-actions/julia-buildpkg@v1```
line

elements.text: yeah, add those lines (with correct indentation) right before the

text: perfect!

like this:
```    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - uses: julia-actions/setup-julia@v1
        with:
          version: ${{ matrix.version }}
          arch: ${{ matrix.arch }}
      - uses: actions/cache@v1
        env:
          cache-name: cache-artifacts
        with:
          path: ~/.julia/artifacts
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-test-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/Project.toml') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-test-${{ env.cache-name }}-
            ${{ runner.os }}-test-
            ${{ runner.os }}-
      - name: install RayTracing
        run: |
          julia --project=@. -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.add(PackageSpec(url="<https://github.com/rvignolo/RayTracing.jl>"))'
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-buildpkg@v1
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-runtest@v1```

text:
Because I did that and got
```ERROR: expected package `NeutronTransport [161f4978]` to be registered```
<https://github.com/rvignolo/NeutronTransport.jl/runs/1574580584>

elements.text: Because I did that and got
ERROR: expected package `NeutronTransport [161f4978]` to be registered

text:
I think this solves the problem:
```julia --project=docs -e '
            using Pkg;  Pkg.add([PackageSpec(url="<https://github.com/rvignolo/RayTracing.jl>"), PackageSpec(url="<https://github.com/rvignolo/NeutronTransport.jl>")])
            Pkg.develop(PackageSpec(path=pwd()))
            Pkg.instantiate()'```

elements.text: I think this solves the problem:

text:
Or better:
```julia --project=docs -e '
            using Pkg;  Pkg.add([PackageSpec(url="<https://github.com/rvignolo/RayTracing.jl>"), PackageSpec(path=pwd())])
            Pkg.develop(PackageSpec(path=pwd()))
            Pkg.instantiate()'```
